definitions.usage: 用作动词，表示对某人或某事的优点、成就或品质表示赞赏，通常用于正式或非正式场合。

examples.scene: 在一个公司年会上，经理在全体员工面前表彰一位表现出色的员工，强调她的努力和成果。
examples.chineseIdea: 想表达对某人工作出色的认可，突出她的贡献让大家知道。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She has @ @ for her outstanding performance this year.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She has 「received praise」 for her outstanding performance this year.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她因今年出色的表现而「受到表扬」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：She is praised because she works good. 纠正：She has received praise for her excellent work.

examples.scene: 在家庭聚会上，父母夸奖孩子在学校的音乐会上表现出色，鼓励他继续努力。
examples.chineseIdea: 想表达对孩子在某方面表现的骄傲，激励他保持进步。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: We should @ @ to him for his amazing violin solo.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: We should 「give praise」 to him for his amazing violin solo.
examples.chineseTranslation: 我们应该为他精彩的小提琴独奏「给予表扬」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：We must praise him because he plays violin very good. 纠正：We should give praise to him for his excellent violin performance.

definitions.usage: 用作不可数名词，表示赞美的话语或行为，通常指公开或私下对某人成就的认可。

examples.scene: 在一场学术会议后，教授对一位学生的研究报告印象深刻，当众表达了赞赏。
examples.chineseIdea: 想表达对某人工作成果的高度评价，让其他人也注意到他的能力。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The professor spoke @ @ @ about her insightful presentation.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The professor spoke 「words of praise」 about her insightful presentation.
examples.chineseTranslation: 教授对她深刻的演讲说了「赞美之词」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：The professor said many good words for her presentation. 纠正：The professor spoke words of praise for her presentation.

examples.scene: 在社交媒体上，一位网友因为分享了感人的公益活动视频而受到大量网友的称赞。
examples.chineseIdea: 想表达某人因善举而受到广泛的认可和赞美。
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Fans 「showered her with praise」 for her inspiring video.
examples.chineseTranslation: 粉丝们对她感人的视频「大加赞扬」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：Fans gave her many praises for the video. 纠正：Fans showered her with praise for the video.
